programme.title: ESPN DOC
programme.desc: Ben van Bilzen is al meer dan vijftig jaar dé materiaalman van NAC Breda en misschien wel een van de bekendste gezichten van de club. In zijn washok, dat er inmiddels uitziet als een echt museum, heeft hij bijna elke speler over de vloer gehad. Terwijl de voetbalwereld razendsnel verandert en spelers komen en gaan, blijft Ben de onvermoeibare, stille kracht achter de club.

programme.desc: Ben van Bilzen is al meer dan vijftig jaar dé materiaalman van NAC Breda en misschien wel een van de bekendste gezichten van de club. In zijn washok, dat er inmiddels uitziet als een echt museum, heeft hij bijna elke speler over de vloer gehad. Terwijl de voetbalwereld razendsnel verandert en spelers komen en gaan, blijft Ben de onvermoeibare, stille kracht achter de club.

programme.title: Voetbal Geeft
programme.desc: De 32-jarige Jeen heeft een verstandelijke beperking en werkt bij de dagbesteding bij sc Heerenveen. Daar ontwikkelt hij zich, werkt hij superhard en bezorgt hij iedereen altijd een lach op het gezicht. Daarom bezorgen zij Jeen nu een onvergetelijke dag en mag hij als vierde doelman meetrainen met Andries Noppert en de hele Heerenveen-selectie.

programme.title: ESPN DOC
programme.desc: Ben van Bilzen is al meer dan vijftig jaar dé materiaalman van NAC Breda en misschien wel een van de bekendste gezichten van de club. In zijn washok, dat er inmiddels uitziet als een echt museum, heeft hij bijna elke speler over de vloer gehad. Terwijl de voetbalwereld razendsnel verandert en spelers komen en gaan, blijft Ben de onvermoeibare, stille kracht achter de club.

programme.title: 2025 NCAA Women's Basketball Tournament
programme.desc: USC (31-3) makes back-to-back Elite Eight appearances for the first time since 1982 to 1984, and beat the Huskies, 72-70, on Dec. 21; UConn (34-3) earned its 29th Elite Eight berth after an 82-59 blowout of Oklahoma behind Paige Bueckers.

programme.title: Get Up
programme.desc: Mike Greenberg, who joined ESPN in 1996 as an anchor, joins former NBA star Jalen Rose for roundtable discussions about the latest sports news making headlines as well as analysis of recent big games and interviews with expert commentators.

programme.title: Pardon the Interruption
programme.desc: Tony Kornheiser and Michael Wilbon, longtime colleagues and friends, engage in verbal sparring during a fast-paced and wide-ranging discussion about current events in the world of sports; Kornheiser and Wilbon also interview special guests.

programme.title: ESPN First Take
programme.desc: Molly Qerim is the moderator while veteran commentators Stephen A. Smith and Max Kellerman discuss and deliberate the latest topics in the world of sports; the debate show also features guest appearances by entertainers, athletes and journalists.

programme.title: NBA Today
programme.desc: Malika Andrews covers the latest news from around the NBA, breaking down the stories making headlines across the league, highlights and takeaways from recent games, and guest interviews to get a unique perspective on the league.

programme.title: The Pat McAfee Show
programme.desc: Former NFL punter Pat McAfee and his friends deliver one-of-a-kind opinions on the latest news making headlines in sports and entertainment, along with special segments and guest interviews with some of the biggest names to give a unique experience.

programme.title: Around the Horn
programme.desc: A panel of reporters from across the country debate trending topics and stories in sports with points being awarded for valid arguments, and at the end of the show, the winner is awarded 30 uninterrupted seconds to discuss any topic of their choice.

programme.title: NFL2Night
programme.desc: The latest news and reports around the NFL are discussed in detail with a panel of expert analysts weighing in on the hottest issues, while veteran football reporters provide up-to-date information from team headquarters across the league.

programme.title: SportsCenter with Scott Van Pelt

programme.title: 2025 College Basketball Crown
programme.desc: Nebraska (17-14) look to rebound following a five-game skid behind All-Big Ten First Team member Brice Williams; Arizona State (13-19) will look to put an end to its five-game losing streak, facing the Cornhuskers for the first time since 2008.

programme.title: 2025 College Basketball Crown
programme.desc: Georgetown (17-15) is one of four Big East representatives in the inaugural tournament, led by All-Big East First Team member Micah Peavy; Washington State (19-14) makes its second-straight postseason appearance, first under new coach David Riley.

programme.title: Coupe de France
programme.desc: Dunkerque is coming off of a 2-0 defeat to Bastia in Ligue 2 on March 28 where they conceded goals to Christophe Vincent and Maxime Blé; Paris SG claimed a 6-1 victory against Saint-Étienne in Ligue 1 on March 29, led by a Désiré Doué brace.

programme.title: NASCAR Craftsman Truck Series
programme.desc: Kyle Larson secured his fourth Truck Series win of his career with his victory at Homestead over Layne Riggs; Christian Eckes won both races at Martinsville last year, defeating Ty Majeski by .644 seconds and Ben Rhodes by 1.191 seconds.

programme.title: Pro Volleyball Federation
programme.desc: Vegas claimed a 3-0 victory over San Diego in their first meeting of the season on Feb. 7, led by 16 kills and 3 blocks from Hannah Maddux; Alisha Glass Childress added 34 assists and 17 digs for the Thrill in the win away from home.

programme.title: UFL Football
programme.desc: St. Louis went 7-3 last season to win the XFL Conference, including a 22-8 win over the Roughnecks on May 4 behind 134 receiving yards and two touchdowns from Hakeem Butler; Houston dropped its last six games to finish the 2024 season at 1-9.

programme.title: PBA Bowling
programme.desc: DeeRonn Booker of Albuquerque, N.M. captured his maiden PBA Tour title and became just the third African Ameran to win a major tournament with his victory in last year's edition held at Suncoast Bowling Center in Las Vegas.

programme.title: NHRA Sportsman Series
programme.desc: The top drag racing teams in the country compete in different classifications; drivers accumulate points based on the results of each event and at the end of the season a champion is crowned in the various drag-racing classes.

programme.title: 2025 College Basketball Crown
